intro: Corydalis pauciflora subsp. arctica, commonly known as Arctic Corydalis, is a perennial herb native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in alpine environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss in cold climates. Corydalis pauciflora subsp. arctica is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with short growing seasons and low temperatures.
